main: ^Ehi! Where do you go with that?
noFeeling: ^I see you have a short memory.
^I’m the guy you left getting beat up by a bully in the park.
^I’m not surprised to find you here.
yesFeeling: ^I’m from your town, remember? We taught that bully a lesson.
second: ^Yes! You're from my town. We already met in the park that time you were arguing with an older guy.
continueNoFeeling: ^Yes, it's true, when you let that bully beat me.
^I’m not surprised to find you here.
continueYesFeeling: ^Yes, it's true, you saved me from that bully, remember? I didn’t think you’d be here.
continueStory: ^I’m here because I’m a PhD student. But what are you doing? I’ve never seen you in college.
continueStory2: ^I remember that time in the park and it’s none of your business what happens to me.

c-0: ^I’m sorry, that time I just got in the way, I didn’t want any trouble.
^I see you’ve stayed loyal to your cowardice.
c-1: ^I was afraid and I didn’t react, I regret it. Unfortunately I can’t change what happened.
^Umpf… At least you look really upset.

continueStory3: ^I'm here for them. I heard that these poor squirrels were transported here for experiments as if they were merchandise. I must release them in a reserve where they will live freely.

c-0: ^The professor is studying them for research, he’s not doing any experiments if that’s what you think. I took care of them myself today.
^Are you kidding me? I can clearly see they're not well.
c-1: ^Is not good for them to living in that cage. They’d be better off in nature, but the professor is doing a research, he’s not doing any experiments, they're in good hands.

g-1: ^As I thought. You have no idea what will happen to them in the future, but you know the end of lab animals.

^Well, I’ll tell you what happens now. First of all, I’m gonna get them out of this prison before you dissect them. Then, together with my friend who is out here, we will free them in the nearest nature reserve, where they can live peacefully in their habitat.

c-2: ^You're right, I’ve seen their conditions too. I don’t want anything bad happen to them.
c-3: ^You have to give them back and leave now.

noFeeling2: ^I don’t want your help, I don’t trust you. We shouldn’t have even met.
yesFeeling2: ^Yes! I knew I could count on you! Come on, follow me.
noFeeling3: ^I expected, you haven’t changed a bit. You still don’t care about others. Once again I can’t count on you.
yesFeeling3: ^Obviously I had the wrong idea about you. Well, never mind. I don't need you.
